definition: Nü Shu writing, a phonetic syllabary for Yao ethnic group 瑶族 瑤族 dialect designed and used by women in Jiangyong county 江永縣|江永县 in southern Hunan
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Nü Shu works are folklores which have special fascination.
sentences.chinese: 女書作品是有着獨特魅力的民間文學。

sentences.english: In 2006, Jiangyong Women's script is registered as world cultural legacy.
sentences.chinese: 2006年中國女書申報世界文化遺產。

sentences.english: Womanese script has been praised as the world's most gender-sensitive language.
sentences.chinese: 女書文字被評價爲是世界上最具性別意識的文字。

definition: (Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
